fields.description: VCU shall communicate on both CAN1 and CAN2 acting as a gateway between two lines. On CAN1 it shall communicate with the BMS, On-Board Charger and Data Logger while on CAN2 with the Coil Driver, FLCU and Display. CAN1 and CAN2 buses baud-rates shall be 250 kbps and 500 kbps respectively. VCU shall also acquire analogue signals through dedicated sensors located in several parts of the vehicle.
VCU messages shall be sent via CAN bus exactly as provided by the latest version of the DBC file (Customer_vx.x.dbc).
VCU analogue and digital I⁄O shall follow the latest pinout file (VCU_Pinout_x.x.xlsx).
The VCU shall be turned on by the Key input on pin 207 and then shall wake up other ECUs. A Key-Off event shall turn off the VCU.
(TBD)

VCU shall acquire CAN1 signals and send them on CAN2, acting as a gateway between CAN buses. In particular, VCU shall redirect information received from the BMS to the display and commands to manage the Coil Driver.
VCU shall acquire motor temperature through a PTC thermistor on pin 103 and send the processed value on CAN2 signal VCU_VEHICLE_INFO_MotorTemp.
VCU shall power the BMS on or off via digital output pin 102 depending on key status: HIGH at Key-On, LOW at Key-Off.
When communicating with the BMS, VCU shall implement a communication timeout on the bus channel.
If a BMS timeout occurs, VCU shall prevent the battery from delivering current and shall stop requesting energy absorption.
VCU shall read BMS status word 1 to obtain general status and identify possible errors, then send a notification message to the display.
VCU shall calculate the actual SoC by analysing and integrating data for state of health, temperature and current absorption.
If an undervoltage error occurs while vehicle speed is zero, VCU shall restart the BMS and immediately request a recharge-only mode.
VCU shall shut down the BMS automatically when: key on, vehicle not charging, vehicle stopped, throttle not pressed for at least 10 min; otherwise the shutdown timer resets.
VCU shall forbid gear selection during Charging Phase by always sending Neutral on CAN.
Vehicle enters Charging Phase when CB_CHARGING.Charging_phase equals 1 or PlugDetection equals TRUE.
VCU shall read BMS status word 2 to obtain warning information and take counter-measures, including sending a display message.
VCU shall compute Wh per km using BMS_FRAME_4_kwh_ds and distance between consecutive samples.
The BMS communication timeout shall be at most 5 s.
VCU shall receive motor RPM from the Coil Driver on CAN2 PGN 64372 (MG1IS1).
engine_rev = 7.13 × wheel_rev.
VCU shall send the computed vehicle speed on CAN2 signal VCU_VEHICLE_INFO_VehicleSpeed.
VCU shall compute partial and total distance and send them on CAN2 signals VCU_VEHICLE_INFO_PartialDistance and VCU_VEHICLE_INFO_TotalDistance.
VCU shall calculate trip distance from vehicle speed using appropriate correction factors.
VCU shall allow the user to reset partial distance to start a new trip counter.
VCU shall store total distance in EEPROM and shall not allow the user to delete it.
Valid driving modes are Neutral, Forward, Reverse.
VCU shall send the driving direction on CAN signal VcuTorqueSpeedThrottleRequest.EvGear and receive Coil Driver response on EcuStateFeedback.EvGearResp.
Parking mode is not foreseen for this project.

At Key-On: mode Neutral, ReadyToStart indicator off, PressBrakeStart on. Pressing the brake enables ReadyToStart and disables PressBrakeStart. With brake pressed, selecting Forward or Reverse disables ReadyToStart again.
Shifting between Direct and Reverse requires Neutral and vehicle speed below 4 km⁄h; shifting is disabled above 6 km⁄h.
Neutral mode corresponds to zero torque request to the inverter.

VCU shall provide command indications for DRL, position, low ⁄ high beam, passing, indicators, hazard, night sensor and welcome animation via VCU_COMMAND_LIGHTS. FLCU shall manage the lights and report status via FLCU_STATUS.
FLCU sets FLCU_ERROR_flcu_status = 1 and cycles through active error codes using FLCU_ERROR_total_actual_errors.
Upon failure, FLCU disables the related function and logs the error for a suitable time.
Acceleration input is provided by two 0-5 V sensors on pins 106 and 129.
VCU shall send throttle-pedal percentage to the Coil Driver on CAN2 signal VcuTorqueSpeedThrottleRequest.ThrottleRequest.
VCU shall verify that the ratio between the two throttle sensor readings is within the valid range.
If readings are consistent, throttle signal equals the weighted average of both sensors.
If readings are inconsistent the throttle equals the higher of the two sensor values.
If one sensor is faulty throttle equals the other; if both sensors are faulty throttle is set to zero.
Incoherent potentiometer readings raise an error flag and activate downgrade.
Brake detection is via a 4.5 kΩ pull-up digital input on pin 178.
Regen braking shall occur on throttle release or brake press and only if the battery can accept charge.
Throttle is set to –20 % until motor RPM reach zero then to 0 %. If pedal is pressed again the current value is used.
Throttle is set to –50 % until motor RPM reach zero then to 0 %. If pedal is pressed again the current value is used.
State sequence: Power-On → Standby (Mode 2 request after pre-charge complete) → Torque Control (Mode 7).
At Key-Off VCU deactivates pin 150 and disconnects the Coil Driver from the BMS.
VCU shall receive FaultCode via CAN1 messages InvFault1 and InvFault2.
VCU shall receive temperature-error bits from BMS_FRAME_1.
Derating activates when specified inverter FaultCodes coincide with BMS temperature errors.
Errors must persist 5 s to trigger; if present after 15 s derating stays active until key cycle, otherwise deactivates.
VCU monitors FaultCodes from InvFault1 and InvFault2 for Turtle Mode logic.
VCU reads BMS_FRAME_3_soc for Turtle Mode activation.
VCU monitors BMS_FRAME_1 errors for Turtle Mode.
Turtle Mode activates if inverter or BMS error persists ≥ 5 s or SoC < 10 %.
Mode remains active if error persists 15 s; deactivates after error free for 2 s.
VCU shall send Message2 to CasaliniDashboard on CAN1 according to the latest DBC.
VCU activates Motor Traction Fault indicator if specified inverter fault codes persist ≥ 5 s.
If fault persists 15 s indicator stays active until key cycle; otherwise deactivates.
VCU activates Powertrain System Fault indicator if any inverter fault persists ≥ 5 s.
Indicator remains active if fault persists 15 s; deactivates after 2 s fault-free.
VCU activates Battery Temperature Fault indicator for specified BMS temperature errors persisting ≥ 5 s.
Indicator remains active if fault persists 15 s; deactivates after key cycle or 2 s fault-free.
VCU activates Traction Battery Fault indicator if a BMS_FRAME_1 error persists ≥ 5 s.
Indicator remains active if fault persists 15 s; deactivates after 2 s fault-free.
VCU activates Charging Temperature Fault indicator for over ⁄ under charging temperature errors persisting ≥ 5 s.
Indicator remains active if fault persists 15 s; deactivates after key cycle or 2 s fault-free.
